metadata.titel_preek: Love against the Odds—Selections from the Song of Songs

kernfrasen: dialogue of the holy Bridegroom and the Bride
I am my beloved’s and he is mine
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS THE BELOVED / COVENANT IS MARRIAGE

kernfrasen: strains forward toward what is not yet
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DIVINE ACTION IS A JOURNEY OUTWARD

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The Word was made flesh... to live 'outside' with us... and to embrace us.

mapping_structuur.bron_element: Moving from inside a house to outside
mapping_structuur.doel_element: The Word leaving the immanent Trinity for the world

cognitieve_implicaties: God is not a static object but a moving agent
The world is a space 'outside' God that He chooses to enter
theologische_implicaties: The Incarnation is an act of divine 'ecstasy' (standing outside oneself)
Trinity is defined by relational movement
ethische_implicaties: Believers should 'go out' toward the 'other' as God did
onbedoelde_consequenties: Spatializing God might imply He was 'absent' from the world before Christ

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the spatial logic of the Bede commentary to explain the Trinity.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: His banner over me is love.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: God's public claim on the soul

cognitieve_implicaties: Love is a visible, protective covering
The believer belongs to a specific 'camp' or identity
ethische_implicaties: Living under a specific standard of conduct
onbedoelde_consequenties: Potential for 'us vs them' tribalism if the military origin is over-emphasized

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A very common phrase in youth ministry and hymnody, though the preacher attempts to revitalize it via the 'banqueting table' context.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher masterfully weaves the erotic/relational domain with the Trinitarian/spatial domain by using the concept of 'ecstasy' (standing outside oneself) as the bridge.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Etymological blending: using the literal meaning of 'ecstasy' (to stand outside) to link human passion to the divine act of entering the world.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' allegorical tradition and makes it cognitively accessible through the spatial logic of 'inside/outside'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Bede's comment on 'If I met you outside, I would kiss you.'

risicos.beschrijving: The strong emphasis on human marriage as the 'only' image might exclude those who are single or have failed marriages.
risicos.voorbeeld: No earthly phenomenon speaks more clearly of the unconditional love of God than a long, faithful marriage.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Alienation of the divorced or single members of the congregation.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Garden of Eden / The Lover's Garden

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; grounds abstract 'eros' in concrete memory.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By linking the 'for better, for worse' vows to the 'unconditional nature' of God's love.

verstoorde_schemas.schema_naam: Song of Songs as purely secular/erotic
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: The Song as a 'layered' text where carnal and spiritual meanings coexist.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly fits the 'Pastors' Conference' context by addressing both pastoral practice (youth ministry) and high theology (Bede/Trinity).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Relational/Familial domain, specifically the 'Marriage' sub-domain. It avoids the 'Economic' domain (debt/payment) entirely, which is refreshing for a sermon touching on the Cross. Instead, it uses 'Spatial/Journey' metaphors to describe the Incarnation, making the theology feel movement-oriented rather than transactional.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'table' to the sensory details of the Song (spices, wine, apples) to ground the Eucharist in the 'carnal' reality mentioned earlier.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The table of the Lord smells of the 'vineyards in blossom' mentioned in the Song.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'erotic energy' in youth to 'long, faithful marriage' in elders.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Refining Fire' metaphor to explain how the heat of the first becomes the warmth of the second.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If the Bridegroom is the only active seeker, the Bride (Church) becomes passive.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Highlight the preacher's own point that the Bride in the Song is 'the equal of the man in every way' to ensure agency.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To expand on the 'Wisdom building her house' mention.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The construction of a virtuous life.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of cognitive homiletics that bridges the gap between physical experience and high dogma.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the use of George Herbert's poetry; CMT analysis shows how that poetry functions to map 'Joy' and 'Love' onto the person of Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the learning styles (anecdote for concrete experience); CMT focuses on how the 'inside/outside' spatial metaphor facilitates the conceptual grasp of the Trinity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher's use of 'ecstasy' is not just a word choice but a cognitive pivot that allows the hearer to map human sexuality onto the Incarnation without contradiction.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: walk in the way of insight
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on 'Text World Theory' by creating a nostalgic world of 1970s youth ministry to make the 'erotic' themes of the Song safe yet vibrant for a pastoral audience.
